item.title: Remembering the Royal Casino Las Vegas: A Quiet Strip Neighbor's History
item.description:
A Convention Center Stalwart: The Royal’s Early Days

Just a stone’s throw east of the legendary Las Vegas Strip, at 99 Convention Center Drive, stood a hotel with a story uniquely intertwined with the city’s booming convention business. Originally opening in 1970 as Royal Las Vegas, it was part of the Royal Executive Inns chain, a budget-friendly option catering to the growing influx of business travelers. Unlike its glitzy Strip counterparts, the Royal aimed to provide reliable, affordable lodging – a vital service as the Las Vegas Convention Center became an increasingly important economic driver.
